page.title: 16The pub at Kirmington
page.content: The Marrowbone & Cleaver is the only Pub in this square.The publican cum butcher was T.M.Frankish in 1861 and presumably this dual occupation explains the name today.This pub name is noted in the 1871 census. During the last war the 166 Squadron was based in Kirmington,and spent their spare time in the pub.They have a reunion each year and revisit the Pub and Church. In August 1985 a new Landlord,his wife and three children moved into the village and pub.They are fund raising for Chistmas parties for the children and Pensioners.The real ale,Draught bass,is the best in the area,and people come from Grimsby,Immingham etc A pint of bitter now costs 80 pence. The lounge bar is well decorated with two real fires in the winter.In the bar,darts and dominoes are played.
